Personal Assistant Job at Seven-Up Bottling Company Limited




        
    

        
        Seven-Up Bottling Company Limited is one of the largest manufacturing companies in Nigeria, producing and distributing some of the nation’s most- loved beverages in the country like; Pepsi, 7Up, Mirinda, Teem, Mountain Dew, H2oH!, Lipton Ice Tea and Aquafina premium drinking water. SBC has recently entered into Home & Personal Care category with the 2SURE brand and launched its first product, a Hand & Surface Sanitizer. Seven Up boasts of nine bottling plants with state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities strategically located across various regions in the country.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant
Job Location: Lagos
Reports To: Senior Executive
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Personal Assistant provides high-level administrative and organizational support to a senior executive, ensuring the smooth running of daily operations.
	The role requires a high degree of professionalism, confidentiality, and discretion while enabling the executive to focus on strategic priorities.


Responsibilities


	Manage and maintain the executive’s calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Draft, review, and edit correspondence, reports, and presentations.
	Handle incoming communication (emails, calls, documents), responding or redirecting as appropriate.
	Liaise with internal teams and external stakeholders on behalf of the executive.
	Organize domestic and international travel (flights, visas, accommodation, itineraries).
	Support in planning events, business meetings, and external engagements.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Track deadlines, deliverables, and progress on key initiatives.
	Manage sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion.
	Act as a professional point of contact while safeguarding the executive’s privacy.
	Strong communication skills (written and verbal).
	Integrity, discretion, and ability to handle confidential matters.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize effectively.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field.
	3–5 years of experience as a PA or EA, preferably supporting senior leadership.
	Experience in Manufacturing company is a PLUS
	Preferably Male
	Proven ability to manage sensitive information and provide high-level support.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cloud Infrastructure Engineer",
  "description": "IT Horizons&nbsp;is a company with diverse talents and skills on existing, recent and upcoming technologies worldwide. We are a team of young, vibrant, ambitious but experienced professionals who deal with everything relating to technologies especially information communication technologies (ICT).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: &nbsp;Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada Phase II, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	A Cloud Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and managing cloud-based systems and processes, ensuring security, scalability, and efficiency in cloud environments.


Job Responsibilities


	Design, build, and manage the cloud infrastructure environment.
	Work closely with IT security to monitor the company&rsquo;s cloud privacy.
	Offer guidance in infrastructure movement techniques including bulk application transfers into the cloud.
	Identify the top cloud architecture solutions to successfully meet the strategic needs of the company.
	Handle and resolve infrastructure issues.
	Collaborate with team members to improve the company&rsquo;s cloud management and deployment plans.
	Perform cloud servers including security configurations, patching, and troubleshooting.
	Develop and organize cloud systems.
	Work closely with the development team to identify and ensure that the cloud solutions meet company standards of reliability.
	Implement and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation.
	Manage disaster recovery and create backup policies.
	Utilize technology to automate tasks and reduce manual efforts.


Qualifications


	B.Sc Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
	Proven experience as a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer or similar role
	Experience with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure etc.)
	Experience with virtualization technologies, such as VMware and Docker
	Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, Java, and Ruby
	Understanding of cloud computing deployment models
	Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
	Experience with network infrastructure, database, and application development
	Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage complex systems

Cloud Infrastructure Engineer Job at IT Horizons Limited




        
    

        
        IT Horizons is a company with diverse talents and skills on existing, recent and upcoming technologies worldwide. We are a team of young, vibrant, ambitious but experienced professionals who deal with everything relating to technologies especially information communication technologies (ICT).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:  Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
Job Location: Gbagada Phase II, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	A Cloud Infrastructure Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and managing cloud-based systems and processes, ensuring security, scalability, and efficiency in cloud environments.


Job Responsibilities


	Design, build, and manage the cloud infrastructure environment.
	Work closely with IT security to monitor the company’s cloud privacy.
	Offer guidance in infrastructure movement techniques including bulk application transfers into the cloud.
	Identify the top cloud architecture solutions to successfully meet the strategic needs of the company.
	Handle and resolve infrastructure issues.
	Collaborate with team members to improve the company’s cloud management and deployment plans.
	Perform cloud servers including security configurations, patching, and troubleshooting.
	Develop and organize cloud systems.
	Work closely with the development team to identify and ensure that the cloud solutions meet company standards of reliability.
	Implement and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation.
	Manage disaster recovery and create backup policies.
	Utilize technology to automate tasks and reduce manual efforts.


Qualifications


	B.Sc Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
	Proven experience as a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer or similar role
	Experience with cloud services (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure etc.)
	Experience with virtualization technologies, such as VMware and Docker
	Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, Java, and Ruby
	Understanding of cloud computing deployment models
	Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
	Experience with network infrastructure, database, and application development
	Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage complex systems
	Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert will be a plus.


Method of Application
